channel.title: It wont work need help!
channel.description: when ever i double click runserver or run.bat it just opens and closes... what do i do?!!?!

item.title: It wont work need help!
item.dc:creator: @Snaz Snaz
item.description:
@Snaz wrote:

ah well,
i’m bored
he’s dumb

thaught i might aswell do a detailed instructions for him

Read full topic

item.title: It wont work need help!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Snaz, post:13, topic:307962”]Ok dude I think your abit dumb so heres what to do!

STEP 1.

FIND OUT WHAT JDK VERSION YOU HAVE. (If you don’t have JDK then please die)

go to My computer > then click on Program files > Then click on ‘Java’ > Then click on JDK > THEN IT WILL HAVE A FOLDER SAYING WHAT VERSION JAVA YOU HAVE.

Now remember what version of JDK you have and go to:

‘My computer’ and left click it and go to ‘Properties’. Now look for ‘Advanced system settings’ (On mine its on the left).

Open up Advanced system settings and at the bottom there should be a button saying ‘Environmental variables’

Click this and something will open with like 2 boxes. In the second box look for a variable called: CLASSPATH

IF YOU HAVE A CLASSPATH VARIABLE:

Double click it to edit and paste this into the variable value:

.;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

IF YOU DONT HAVE A CLASSPATH VARIABLE:

Click on ‘New’ in the second box area and do the following:

Variable name: CLASSPATH
Variable value: .;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

BTW NOW YOU NEED TO CHANGE THE ‘jdk1.6.0_12’ TO YOUR VERSTION OF JDK!!!

Ok now add a new variable again and type in the following:

Variable name: PATH
Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

(DONT FORGET TO CHANGE THE VERSION TO YOUR VERSION AGAIN) !!!

Ok now you need to go onto your server folder and right click on the ‘Runserver’ or whatever .bat file runs your server,

and go to ‘Edit’.

Delete everything in their and paste this into it:

@echo off title server tskill java /a "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

AND AGAIN DONT FORGET TO CHANGE THE JDK VERSTION TO YOURS IN THE CODE ^ ^ ^

Hope this helps - and if it doesn’t then just give up making your server lols.

Goodluck.[/quote]
He dosen’t need to be spoonfed, just give him simple instrcution, and he probably didn’t follow the ‘guide’ on how to make a ‘server’

Read full topic

item.title: It wont work need help!
item.dc:creator: @Snaz Snaz
item.description:
@Snaz wrote:

Ok dude I think your abit dumb so heres what to do!

STEP 1.

FIND OUT WHAT JDK VERSION YOU HAVE. (If you don’t have JDK then please die)

go to My computer > then click on Program files > Then click on ‘Java’ > Then click on JDK > THEN IT WILL HAVE A FOLDER SAYING WHAT VERSION JAVA YOU HAVE.

Now remember what version of JDK you have and go to:

‘My computer’ and left click it and go to ‘Properties’. Now look for ‘Advanced system settings’ (On mine its on the left).

Open up Advanced system settings and at the bottom there should be a button saying ‘Environmental variables’

Click this and something will open with like 2 boxes. In the second box look for a variable called: CLASSPATH

IF YOU HAVE A CLASSPATH VARIABLE:

Double click it to edit and paste this into the variable value:

.;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

IF YOU DONT HAVE A CLASSPATH VARIABLE:

Click on ‘New’ in the second box area and do the following:

Variable name: CLASSPATH
Variable value: .;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

BTW NOW YOU NEED TO CHANGE THE ‘jdk1.6.0_12’ TO YOUR VERSTION OF JDK!!!

Ok now add a new variable again and type in the following:

Variable name: PATH
Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

(DONT FORGET TO CHANGE THE VERSION TO YOUR VERSION AGAIN) !!!

Ok now you need to go onto your server folder and right click on the ‘Runserver’ or whatever .bat file runs your server,

and go to ‘Edit’.

Delete everything in their and paste this into it:

@echo off title server tskill java /a "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

AND AGAIN DONT FORGET TO CHANGE THE JDK VERSTION TO YOURS IN THE CODE ^ ^ ^

Hope this helps - and if it doesn’t then just give up making your server lols.

Goodluck.

Read full topic

item.title: It wont work need help!
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

super101:

now it says its not recognised as an internal or external source or batch file

Back to what snaz said!

It’s your Environmental Variables, they’re set incorrectly OR you do not have JDK installed and maybe just downloaded.

Go to your program files and find Java and see if there’s a JDK 6_16 or something along those lines. If so, find your Java or Javac in there and copy + paste the file location to your path… Or edit your classpath to _16 not _14 or _15 unless they’re the version you have.

Read full topic

item.title: It wont work need help!
item.dc:creator: @Snaz Snaz
item.description:
@Snaz wrote:

look for your java location
most probably:

C: > Program Files > Java > Jdk

Then see what version you have and edit your version where it says ‘jdk1.6.0_12’

Save it and it should work.

@echo off title server tskill java /a "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Read full topic

java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server[/quote]
Try adding pause to the end of the batch file, also make sure you have jre or jdk.
